item.title: Genesis 1:1 - In the Beginning God
item.description:
Genesis 1:1 - “In the Beginning God Created the Heavens and the Earth”

Text and Translation

Hebrew: בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ
Transliteration: Bereshit bara Elohim et hashamayim ve’et ha’aretz
Literal: “In beginning created God [object marker] the heavens and [object marker] the earth”

Exegetical Analysis

“In the Beginning” (בְּרֵאשִׁית)

The opening word establishes the temporal framework for all that follows. This is not merely a beginning, but the beginning—the absolute commencement of created reality. The Hebrew construct form links this beginning specifically to what God is about to do.

item.title: The Doctrine of God - Divine Attributes
item.description:
The Doctrine of God: Divine Attributes

Introduction

The study of God’s attributes forms the foundation of all theological reflection. Understanding who God is—His essential nature and perfections—shapes every other aspect of Christian doctrine and practice.

Definition of Divine Attributes

Divine attributes are the perfections or qualities that belong to God’s essential nature. They are not additions to God’s being but are identical with His essence. God does not have attributes; rather, God is His attributes.
